metadata.source: X12 / Washington Publishing Company (WPC) - CARC list
metadata.note: Curated subset of most common denial-related CARC codes. Full list at wpc-edi.com.

group_codes.CO: Contractual Obligation — Adjustment based on contract terms. Provider cannot bill the patient for this amount.
group_codes.PR: Patient Responsibility — Amount the patient owes (deductible, coinsurance, copay, non-covered).
group_codes.OA: Other Adjustment — Adjustment not attributable to contract or patient (e.g., COB, prior payer payment).
group_codes.PI: Payer Initiated — Payer-initiated reduction not based on contract. Provider may appeal or bill the patient.
group_codes.CR: Correction/Reversal — Adjustment from a previous claim correction.

1.appeal_guidance: Generally not appealable. Verify deductible status with payer. Member may request EOB review if deductible was already met.

2.appeal_guidance: Generally not appealable. Verify plan benefit details and coinsurance percentage.

3.appeal_guidance: Generally not appealable. Verify copay schedule matches plan.

4.description: The procedure code is inconsistent with the modifier used or a required modifier is missing.
4.appeal_guidance: Review modifier requirements. Correct and resubmit with appropriate modifier. Check LCD/NCD for modifier rules if Medicare.

5.description: The procedure code/bill type is inconsistent with the place of service.
5.appeal_guidance: Verify place of service matches procedure. Correct and resubmit if billing error.

6.description: The procedure/revenue code is inconsistent with the patient's age.
6.appeal_guidance: Verify patient age and procedure code age restrictions. If correct, appeal with clinical documentation.

9.description: The diagnosis is inconsistent with the patient's age.
9.appeal_guidance: Verify diagnosis code. If clinically appropriate, appeal with supporting documentation.

11.description: The diagnosis is inconsistent with the procedure.
11.appeal_guidance: Review diagnosis-procedure pairing. May need to add or change diagnosis code to support medical necessity.

15.description: The authorization number is missing, invalid, or does not apply to the billed services or provider.
15.appeal_guidance: Obtain or verify auth number. If auth was obtained, resubmit with correct auth number. If not obtained, check if retroactive auth is available.

16.description: Claim/service lacks information or has submission/billing error(s).
16.appeal_guidance: Review RARC code for specific missing information. Correct and resubmit. Check for missing fields on CMS-1500 or UB-04.

18.appeal_guidance: Verify claim was not previously submitted and paid. If not a duplicate, appeal with documentation showing distinct services.

22.description: This care may be covered by another payer per coordination of benefits.
22.appeal_guidance: Determine primary payer. Submit to primary first, then submit to secondary with primary EOB attached.

23.description: The impact of prior payer(s) adjudication including payments and/or adjustments.
23.appeal_guidance: This reflects COB adjustment. Verify primary payer payment was applied correctly. Submit primary EOB if not already on file.

26.appeal_guidance: Verify member effective date. If member was eligible, appeal with enrollment documentation.

27.appeal_guidance: Verify member termination date. If member was still eligible, appeal with enrollment documentation or COBRA proof.

29.description: The time limit for filing has expired.
29.appeal_guidance: Check payer-specific timely filing limit. If filed timely, appeal with proof of timely submission (electronic confirmation, certified mail receipt). Medicare allows 1 year from DOS.

31.description: Patient cannot be identified as our insured.
31.appeal_guidance: Verify member ID, name, and DOB. Resubmit with corrected member information.

45.description: Charge exceeds fee schedule/maximum allowable or contracted/legislated fee arrangement.
45.appeal_guidance: Generally not appealable for in-network. For out-of-network, verify allowed amount calculation. Member may owe balance for OON services depending on state law.

50.description: These are non-covered services because this is not deemed a 'medical necessity' by the payer.
50.appeal_guidance: Strongest appeal path. Gather clinical documentation supporting necessity. Include physician letter of medical necessity, clinical notes, prior treatment history. Check payer medical policy for specific criteria.

96.description: Non-covered charge(s). At least one Remark Code must be provided.
96.appeal_guidance: Check RARC code for specific reason. May be plan exclusion, experimental service, or benefit limit reached. Review plan document for coverage terms.

97.description: The benefit for this service is included in the payment/allowance for another service/procedure that has already been adjudicated.
97.appeal_guidance: Review bundling rules (CCI edits for Medicare). If services are truly separate, appeal with modifier 59 or XE/XS/XP/XU modifiers and documentation of distinct service.

109.description: Claim/service not covered by this payer/contractor. You must send the claim/service to the correct payer/contractor.
109.appeal_guidance: Identify correct payer. Resubmit to appropriate plan. Common with Medicare Advantage vs Original Medicare routing.

119.description: Benefit maximum for this time period or occurrence has been reached.
119.appeal_guidance: Verify benefit limits in plan document. If medically necessary beyond limit, request exception or peer-to-peer review.

167.appeal_guidance: Review plan exclusions. Consider if alternative diagnosis code is clinically appropriate. If diagnosis is correct, appeal with clinical justification.

197.appeal_guidance: Similar to CARC 15. Obtain retroactive auth if payer allows. Document medical necessity and urgency if emergent. Check if service type truly requires auth per payer policy.

204.description: This service/equipment/drug is not covered under the patient's current benefit plan.
204.appeal_guidance: Review plan benefit document. Verify correct plan is on file. If covered, appeal with plan documentation. If not covered, explore alternative coverage or patient assistance programs.

242.description: Services not provided by network/primary care providers.
242.appeal_guidance: Verify provider network status. If OON, check if network exception applies (no in-network provider available). Check state surprise billing protections.

252.description: An attachment/other documentation is required to adjudicate this claim/service.
252.appeal_guidance: Submit requested documentation. Check RARC for specific attachment needed. Resubmit with all required supporting documents.

256.description: Service not payable per managed care contract.
256.appeal_guidance: Review managed care contract terms. If service should be covered, escalate through provider relations or file formal dispute.
